required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Carriere® Motion™ Appliance on Airway Dimensions
clinical_study.official_title: Short Term Effect of Carriere® Motion™ Appliance on Pharyngeal Airway Dimensions: A Prospective Controlled Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Objectives: to evaluate the effect of distalization with Carriere® Motion™ Appliance on airway dimensions using lateral cephalometric radiographs and to evaluate the skeletal and dental changes associated with the treatment by this appliance.
Materials and Methods: This controlled clinical trial included patients with Class II molar relationships and divided into two matched groups; treatment group treated with Carriere® Motion™ Appliance and a control group for untreated patients . Skeletal, dental and airway dimensional changes were measured using lateral cephalograms at two time intervals; at baseline and after distalization with Carriere® Motion™ Appliance.

primary_outcome.time_frame: a range of 6 to 12 months. From the day of taking the initial lateral cephalometric radiograph before distalization to the day of taking the second lateral cephalometric radiograph when molar distalization is achieved

secondary_outcome.time_frame: a range of 6 to 12 months. From the day of the taking the initial lateral cephalometric radiograph to the day of taking the second lateral cephalometric radiograph in the follow up period and before starting the orthodontic treatment

clinical_study.condition: Effect of Carriere® Motion™ Appliance on Airway Dimensions
Effect of Carriere® Motion™ Appliance on Skeletal and Dental Measurements

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Class II molar relationship.
- Full set of teeth from 1st molar to 1st molar.
- Age: between 12 and 20 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Craniofacial deformities.
- Previous orthodontic treatment.
- History of respiratory illness.

overall_contact.last_name: Salha Aljohani, BDS, MSc, MOrth RCS(Ed), PhD

contact.last_name: Salha Aljohani, BDS, MSc, MOrth RCS(Ed), PhD
